website_summaries.verdict: A good value on this press that may need a little handle tightening, but is designed to last a long time.
pros: Handle is wrapped in a stainless steel coil that helps keep it cool
Comes pre-seasoned and ready to use
Size fits about two patties at the same time
Has a nice heavy and substantial feeling
Made to last a long time
cons: The handle on this model is not secure and may need tightening

customer_reviews.title: Secondary use!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly i gave up bacon. Now i use both of them as door stops! They work better than anything else i've ever tried! They dont scratch the floor, dont stub my toes on them. When the crosswind picks up they hold my solid wood door with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love
customer_reviews.text: Although I read reviews stating people had trouble connecting the handle, I am 76 years old and had no problem at all. In fact, just hand tightening made it tight enough that there was no movement in the handle. I did however, tighten it with the screw driver and pliers as suggested in the instructions (which are found on the package when the item is removed). No problem with rust (seasoned it as suggested). The handle is black and not chrome as pictured. The press works perfectly and is just the right size. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Mkgbird

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for grill cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I love to grill and thought that a spatula was all needed to cook on one. Then I remembered the grill in my old building when I was growing up. The guys who cooked there always used a grill press much like this one. I now know why. Hamburgers, Steaks, Fish and Hot Dogs all come out better and cook more evenly with this. No more meat that balloons in the middle or fish that cooks unevenly. I don't know how I did without it.
customer_reviews.author: H-Spike

customer_reviews.title: Worth the weight
customer_reviews.text: I find that I use this grill press quite often. It seems to be the right weight, although there are times that I wish it was a bit larger. I like my grilled cheese sandwiches smashed and this does a good job of doing that. My mother always made grilled cheese with an old clothes iron, but this does a better job and cleans up easily. It's also fine for burgers and other foods.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Edition Listener

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bacon and smash burgers
customer_reviews.text: Great for burgers and bacon on the Blackstone Grill. I used this frequently and clean it the same as my cast iron skillets and Blackstone. The handle, despite advertisement, does still get very hot if you use this a while. I keep a small towel handy while using it and it's never an issue. Great product over all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid grill press
customer_reviews.text: One of the handle mounting holes had not been bored out from the factory, so it would not accommodate the hardware. It was completely filled with slag. Fortunately I work in an automotive shop and like to break stuff. My air drill equipped with a carbide bit took care of that problem lickety split. Purchased this mainly for making smashburgers at home, and for keeping bacon from curling up. Once I got this assembled, it feels pretty solid. I used a 3/8" combination wrench and a beefy flathead screwdriver, along with a couple of small locking washers (recommended) We'll see how it holds up. I imagine it'll last forever with proper care just like a cast iron pan.
customer_reviews.author: bigslim

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Well, when it came I had to screw the handle on which I immediately was like "who has time for allllll of that??" lolll but its definitely worth the buy, saw the something at home depot for about $5 more. After a while of using the screws come a but loose but that could just be ME not tightening them as much as I should. But its WORTH buying, has a great weight on it, sturdy and so easy to clean. It also fits completely even with 2 6oz burgers, if your burgers are bigger then you'd need to use one weight per burger patty.
customer_reviews.author: MissM

customer_reviews.title: That's the way the Lodge Cast iron Crumbles?
customer_reviews.text: Purchasing this item, my biggest worry was the assembly that so many reviewers seem to have complained about. Instead, upon taking it out of the box I noticed that the bottom plate has an uneven coating and is actually flaking off on one end. Putting my nail against it (with very little pressure) even more starts to flake off. I included a picture so judge for yourself. Am I supposed to scrape off everything and re-season? That's not what I paid for. I will try and return/exchange and will update this review once things change.
customer_reviews.author: PWN

customer_reviews.title: Will be covered in rust within 24 hours after first use no matter how good you treat it
customer_reviews.text: Used only once.. Handwashed, dried properly and covered with oil as per instruction. And yet it started rusting next morning. Item is not eligible for return so please mind this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How hard is it to include screws and nuts that thread onto each other?
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? Screws and nuts have been in existence for hundreds of years. How is it possible to get this simple technology wrong? How do you screw up screws and nuts? I recently bought two of of these Rectangular Cast Iron Grill Presses. (6.75 x 4.5") with Cool-Grip Spiral Handle The first one had a defective nut and the screw was quite difficult to thread initially. While I was able to correctly thread the problem nut, the second one had the same problem. One nut didn't want to thread onto the screw. I've contacted Lodge. If they send working fasteners, I'm happy to change this review to a 4 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W Mumma

customer_reviews.title: Smashburgers and Bacon!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to make smash burgers and bacon on my Kamado Joe Cooker. I am happy with them! They are pretty big and nice and heavy. Sturdy handle. For those stating otherwise, you need to use a tool called at wrench or a ratchet to tighten the bolts up. duh. They do what they are intended to do, and do it well. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Item is much much smaller than it appears to be in the picture
customer_reviews.text: This item did not meet my expectations at all. It is supposed to be a bacon press and it's about half the length of a normal strip of bacon rendering it mostly useless. It's not nearly as large as it appears to be in Amazon's picture! So be sure to pay special attention if dimensions are listed for this product. My strips of bacon are about 11" long (normal size) and this little press is only 6 1/2" I'm sorry I feel so foolish being duped by the picture of this product
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after one use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this once and the second time I took it out to use it I saw it was rusting! Waste of money. Do not purchase! Update: Their customer service is also terrible. I called and spoke to their representative. She informed me that their products are prone to rusting and that there is nothing they can do about that. Great. Thanks for that.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklynsprouts

customer_reviews.title: This is a well-constructed grill press just a few disadvantages that may not concern others
customer_reviews.text: My Lodge 6.75 x 4.5" Cast Iron Grill Press with Cool-Grip is good to have around. It's well made of good materials by a trusted manufacturer, and definitely holds a small chunk of beef tightly against a grilling surface. Unfortunately, it's a bit short for most cuts of meat, and does not cover two hamburger patties. Finally, my recent experiences with this press suggest that the term "Cool-Grip Handle" may to be a misnomer. In short, it might be advisable to keep a thick oven-mitt handy whenever using this product on a grill or in a skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality screw attachment
customer_reviews.text: I am usually a big fan of lodge, but this was ridiculous. The weight itself is fine cast iron, but the screw to connect the weight to the handle doesn’t fit the nut and is an overall cheap piece of metal. They ruined the functionality by cutting 10 cents of materials
customer_reviews.author: andrew Frey

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love using this on my range griddle. It was simple to put together out of the box.....use a locking pliers on one end and it's really simple (not sure people are struggling). The handle doesn't stay COLD...and at times can heat up to the point that I have to use a cooking close...but I don't care. It's easy to clean...just water...no soap to keep it seasoned and not rust. I love using it on sausage patties, bacon and grilled cheese sandwiches....yum....
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill press.
customer_reviews.text: Nice grill press. Made very well and easy to put together. Cleans up fast with regular dish soap and water. I dry it with a dish towel right after washing it, Do not put it in the dishwasher. I recently bought a cast iron square grill pan and this press is great with it to give those grill marks and to cook food faster. MADE IN THE USA
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do, weighs down bacon or other meats you are cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mainly for cooking bacon and it works great nice and heavy keeps the bacon flat. I have used it for burgers as well and I got a great crust using this. You need a pretty large skillet (10 inches or larger) to use this with other wise it will not lay flat.
customer_reviews.author: home cook

customer_reviews.title: Good Weight!
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy this grill press, you have to understand that it's a piece of cast iron. That means that you need to season it just like you season your cast iron pans. If you treat it with tender, loving care, it'll reciprocate forever. This grill press makes wonderful grill marks for my burgers, grilled sandwiches, hot dogs, etc. and it's super durable. For the people having issues with rusting, STOP washing it with water and letting it hang dry. Make sure it's free from moisture! Free from moisture = free from rust. Highly recommended. It's a steal at $9.99.
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, fell apart after one use
customer_reviews.text: Used once and Handel came off, the screws fell into grass and now it is useless
customer_reviews.author: luis espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: After the first use, mine rusted. I washed it and even sprayed it wil oil and it still rusted. I like the weight of the product and it does what it is suppose to but the rust is horrible. I tried cleaning it several times and it won't come off. It transferred onto my food. Sadly, I'm going have to just throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse's girl

customer_reviews.title: Too Small, Handle Hot, Spend the $ elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: For bacon on a black stone griddle- save your money and just go buy the actual press made by blackstone (available at lowes). A few dollars more but worth it. This press is too small for bacon. Your bacon will still curl up. Extra tools are required to tighten the handle. Handle gets hot if cooking anything, and not using as just a quick press. Need an extra towel or glove to remove. If you plan to use as a door stop as another lady did, this is great for it. If you plan to use for cooking, go buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: PaulaMarie11

customer_reviews.title: Great little item
customer_reviews.text: Tired of your bacon shriveling up to nothing? Well this is what you need. Like all other Lodge pieces I've had, this is a quality product that does a good job. I do wish the handle would fold or swivel down for easier storage, but that is no biggie. One item of note: This size press is more the size of a half-length of bacon, and not nearly large enough to work well on full size pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like it but the screw design that holds the handle on is ridiculous. Every time it heats up and cools back down the screws come loose and have to be re tightened. I'd use some loctite but I'm hesitant to do it on something that will be touching my food and getting quite hot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than what I like
customer_reviews.text: 1) pretty small 2) rusts if you look at it cross-eyed For me, these are more suited as decorations. They are too small to smoosh burgers on the griddle, and too small to effectively flatten full strips of bacon. You have to wash and oil them up or they will rust. That makes sense for a cast-iron pan but not so much for a grill press. I would get a big anodized aluminum press instead.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Tame your bacon!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to keep bacon from curling up into pigtails and not cooking well. It works great for keeping the strips from curling up and seems to help cook them more evenly. I plant to try it making smashburgers next. Easy to clean with warm water. I don't soap my cast iron so I just wash it while it's still a little warm and them wipe it clean with a dry towel.
customer_reviews.author: KW681

customer_reviews.title: It's Lodge
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking with cast iron products, and I blame my grandmother for this. Having grown up using them, they dont feel heavy to me and everyone knows you have to keep them seasoned. A lot of the reviews one here, at least with pictures, the rusted ones look dry and unseasoned. I am wondering if that is what happened. If you know how to keep cast iron seasoned and ready to go, then this product is great. It does the job and I havent had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It is a Lodge, what more can I say
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy here, just a piece of cast iron to press your meat. I have two and use them on my steaks and chicken breast and/or thighs. Just enough weight to keep the sides from curling but not to heavy to squish all the juices out. Cooking tip, slit the fat on the side of beef steaks or pork chops and it want curl up while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Kennect32

customer_reviews.title: Handle easily shifts when pressing
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for about a season but the handle being on a hinge you always had to be careful when pressing down so your hand didn't shift one direction and get burned. The coil looking thing on the handle eventually snapped while pressing almost resulting in a burn. I would go for one with a stable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R.

customer_reviews.title: Works!!  But not for what you expect.... =)
customer_reviews.text: Confession: and likely to get my hiney kicked by carnivores everywhere. But! I still sniff and appreciate meat, carny away. But I bought this as a tofu press. And who'da thunk, it works! Genius! Slap on a plate, put this puppy on there, and pour off every 10 min. or so. Works just as well as that dumb $50 tofu press. Come on, I'm veg, and still don't understand that! Come to the dark side, use this. No more balancing 16 dishes and bowls for it all to fall over in 2 minutes. Wee!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Ideal
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these so I could cook for larger groups. It was a good decision. These are high quality and do the job. Be sure to season them first so that food doesn't stick to them, but they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cast Iron Press, works ok, a little too small for bacon but ok for burgers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cast iron press to use on our cast iron griddle when camping, found that it is ok for burgers or small steaks but not large enough for large strips of bacon without cutting them in half. Other than the fact that you have to cut the bacon to use the press it works and is easy to clean and use. Recommend but wish that it was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Coplin SR

customer_reviews.title: The key to better cooking
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I finally bought this item. I had no difficulty attaching the handle. It does get a bit warm, so a cloth or mitt is recommended when lifting. Easy to clean and store. Helps chops, chicken breasts, sandwiches cook evenly. Such a simple tool and at this price, not a luxury.
customer_reviews.author: Prairie94

customer_reviews.title: Might be a fake?..
customer_reviews.text: Seems like I received a Fake Lodge. It’s for sure a press. And made out of cast iron. But it doesn’t feel like a real Lodge. The one I received also has a weird, what seems to be a misplaced, number 2 right where the logo is at. When viewing the press online or at other stores, it does not have that number randomly by the logo. Other than that. The packaging looked authentic and it does still work well.
customer_reviews.author: edgar

customer_reviews.title: Needs Phillips Head Screws
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted it and I got it. Great for the bacon. I am sure we will find other uses for it. Putting it together should have been simple, but I had to replace the screws and nuts because during the installation I could not tighten the regular head screw. I replaced them with Phillip head screws that was much easier to grip and tighten the nuts. The slotted screwdriver kept slipping and I could not get any leverage to tighten the lock nuts that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: V W Price

customer_reviews.title: Lodge Bacon Press
customer_reviews.text: Found this Lodge Bacon Press was reduced on Amazon, so ordered, had been wanting one. After installing the 2 screws and washers in the handle it was ready for use. Its everything you would expect from Lodge, it's a quality iron bacon press. It works well to press Cuban bread as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mark Bryan

customer_reviews.title: No grill marks as expected, but heavy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Needs grill lines, disappointed. I prefer to cook on a griddle and without the lines on burgers and such it just doesnt have the appeal, so I bought this. It works to flatten and help even heat distribution, but it's not a complete solution. When I find one w grill Mark's this one might get thrown away or stored for rare use like for flattening bacon strips on the griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Karie

customer_reviews.title: My New Grill Friend
customer_reviews.text: Love at first press. I didn't know I was missing this baby, now I can't seem to keep my hands off the Cool' grip Spiral Handle ( which really does work by the way). Extremely easy to assemble and ever so sturdy when done. Built to work, built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Will-i-am

customer_reviews.title: Great for Griddles
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for making bacon on a griddle, as well as things like smash burgers, paninis, etc. I was an idiot though an left it sitting on top of the griddle overnight on night- and it was covered in rust the next day. The rust on the griddle came off very easily, but the cast iron is a bit more work.
customer_reviews.author: DGC80

customer_reviews.title: Great piece....careful of the handle
customer_reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with this product. Only four stars because more than once I got a surprise when I touched the handle in the wrong place. Size is right for smaller presser jobs. It has a nice look so I can leave this out on a shelf as part of my decor. Given its weight it is not something that is necessarily easy to store in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Angold

customer_reviews.title: Substantial.
customer_reviews.text: Flat bacon at last!! This also makes the bacon cook faster and with less spatter. The coiled wire handle feels comfortable to hold. Would make a good doorstop if accidentally gifted to a vegetarian person in something like a Secret Santa gift party.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Our adult children were home at Thanksgiving and my wife used her cast iron press to grill sandwiches. Both children were thoroughly impressed with the effectiveness and simplicity of press. We bought two more for Christmas oresents for our children.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great size and work perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: These come unassembled, so you will need to add the handles to the press. I've already used them on several occasions, and they work great! I just keep them coated in canola oil between uses, and they are always ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and use it all of the time to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and use it all of the time to make smash burgers for the family. Just make sure you care for it like you do for your other cast iron items..
customer_reviews.author: MusicaNitida

customer_reviews.title: Fooled me
customer_reviews.text: The worst part is the exposed screw heads on the bottom. Forget to dry it like a cast iron skillet the first time I washed it, so it rusted a little; my bad. Now I understand why there isn’t a picture showing the bottom. Good job Lodge - not!
customer_reviews.author: A & R

customer_reviews.title: Tips for Securing the Handle. NO EXTRA PARTS NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: What a great addition to our tool set. I have seen a lot of reviews regarding the handle. The hardware they include in the package works perfectly and is very secure. Those that are inexperienced with tools might think otherwise. You need to clamp the nut with a wrench or something similar while using a screwdriver on the screw to secure the handle. Otherwise the screw and nut will turn together. NO EXTRA PARTS NEEDED! Lodge continues to deliver excellent, long lasting products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A cooking must have
customer_reviews.text: Only dislike is that I didn't buy two. Even helps defrosting smaller items such as hamburger patties or small steaks. Put this on top and the frozen meat on a dense, metal surface. Will thaw in half the time. Also great for keeping large hamburger patties from turning into large hamburger meatballs.
customer_reviews.author: LEH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Compliment to My Lodge Griddle
customer_reviews.text: I like grilled sandwiches and this grill press produces succulent, crispy sandwiches. I place the press on the griddle while the griddle is preheating so it is at temperature as well. The result is a crunchy sandwich just like you get in a cafe. I read some people had issues attaching the handle, but I did not and the handle remains solidly attached after many uses.
customer_reviews.author: DPRoger

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Machined Hardware...
customer_reviews.text: For what this product is and does, I'm not too happy about having to scrummage through my shop or go out to the hardware store to get new screws and hex nuts for it. The manufacturer needs to implement some quality control here. Expect a difficult time placing just two screws. Other than that, it's just a nice, flat, heavy piece of cast iron with a handle. I fully expect it to perform well...
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A must need tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing to fry bacon with. It keeps bacon from curling up on edges, which doesnt get cooked enough. This allows the bacon today flat with even cooking. You can also use this to sear meats, making it juicy and favorable.
customer_reviews.author: gabulldawg

customer_reviews.title: Overall, good value. Not sure what i expected
customer_reviews.text: As some have mentioned, cleaning can be a bit of chore because of the screw holes. Also, it's not very large, so at best, you're pressing two burgers, or three slices of bacon. Is someone expected to have a stash of these on-hand? Lastly, it's a little tough to keep the seasoning going on this. Seems like it's easier to keep a pan clean and seasoned.
customer_reviews.author: Mano

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: The thing that I love most about using this grill press is that my hamburgers cook evenly and they stay flat so when I put the veggies on they stay on instead of falling off of a narrow thick piece of meat. This press is the perfect weight! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Margie1958

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to tighten
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to tighten the handle to the the press securely. Try as I might (and several other people I enlisted to help) we were unable to get a solid attachment of the handle. I don't believe it's supposed to be loose but ours was. I'm guessing the tolerances on some of these have been bad. I'll order a different type without a detachable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Makes me look like I am a pro!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool thing! I use it on anything I put on the grill or the griddle - hamburgers, boneless chicken breasts, salmon - I mean every thing. It assists with the cooking and I do look very cool using it. People remark about it too. I already sold two others by using it. And it cleans up like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I like using this on my griddle to press bacon and sausage to the heat. It works great. I wish it were larger, but it is excellent for its size.
customer_reviews.author: maddog24

customer_reviews.title: Lodge Cast Iron Grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kitchen gadget for cooking burgers, bacon and many other meats. The weight is heavy and sturdy. It can go from the stove top to the oven to the grill. I had a little trouble putting it together, but hey, if I can do it, you can too. And I didn't use any tools. So glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: EMarie

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I did not even use this although I bought it to use to keep bacon flat when frying. I washed and dried this before use and was surprised to see it had rust all around the edges. I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Bagger

customer_reviews.title: It's a lodge bacon/meat press. It's awesome and priced right.
customer_reviews.text: I like Lodge stuff, so I'm a little biased, but this item is nice. I should say the handle is black, not stainless. It works exactly as functioned. Took two minutes to screw together and looks nice on the counter. I liked it enough to buy father one just because.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: Good companion tool for Lodge combo griddle/grill stove top cast iron cookware
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I make grilled sandwiches like grilled ham and cheese. I also use it with thicker cuts of steak or pork loins when using my stove top griddle/grill.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Tremayne

customer_reviews.title: Porch Pirated????
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in tact, it works like it should etc. When I received this package it was torn into and smelled awful (a bad perfume) as though it was at somebody’s house. I am not sure if my package was porch pirated and returned because they didn’t like what was in it. Again the package was ripped right open upon my arrival from work.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this thing. Me Not so much. It does make the bacon cook more evenly. But why have something else to clean up? Nothing wrong with the product seems to be high quality. Heavy!
customer_reviews.author: JLSmith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cubanos!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making cubanos! Right weight to squish the bread down and making the sandwich deliver. Found it easy to put together. Going to try it on grilled cheese next.
customer_reviews.author: BabeOBooks

customer_reviews.title: Lodge quality, great tool
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Lodge. There is something about cooking with black iron that cannot be replicated by other surfaces. I use this press to make Smash burgers, grilled cheese, and Cuban sandwiches. No need for any fancy electric sandwich press to take up space in your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: too small. Only covers two pieces of bacon, and only covers 3/4 of the length of those two pieces of bacon. Much too small for baking would work better for a hamburger, a single hamburger patty
customer_reviews.author: Mark / Louisville KY

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I cooked on a griddle without this...
customer_reviews.text: Just a nice bacon weight and gives the very best results. Good too for smashing balls of hamburger and breakfast sausage - or even toasting bread. One of my favorite cooking tools - and I have tons of cooking tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Jeffrey S Forrester

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday gift for my boyfriend and he loves it. He originally wanted it to make burgers with and has eaten soooo many burger since he got it. He says he likes the handle and the weight I perfect to make sure his patties don’t puff up into meatballs lol.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wood

customer_reviews.title: You'll love this press!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite kitchen accessories. Of course, being a Lodge product it performs exactly as designed. As long as you clean it correctly after each use your heirs will be using it someday!
customer_reviews.author: dogpatch75

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smashburgers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make smashburgers on my new Blackstone grill and it works perfectly! I really wanted the round version, but at twice the price it wasn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: Great press. Just the right size. Love the sturdy handle. It was not hard to attach. It is heavy and is not tipsy. Handle does not get hot so it is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Prime shopper

customer_reviews.title: Super nice
customer_reviews.text: Best applewood smoked bacon ever! Just take care it it as all cast iron items. Wash and dry immediately and season with a little oil and bake and cool. Ready for next time.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Venno

customer_reviews.title: Makes killer crispy quesadillas
customer_reviews.text: This gets hot fast and evenly. Makes great quesadillas that are perfectly crispy. Pros: works well Cons: this will not add grill marks it is flat.
customer_reviews.author: Well Hello

customer_reviews.title: Missing the washers?
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say it comes with washers for the screws but mine had none. Some people complain about it coming apart and I hope this isn't an issue.

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction.

product_meta.title: Lodge Pre-Seasoned Cast Iron Grill Press With Cool-grip Spiral Handle, 4.5 inch X 6.75 inch, Black
product_meta.description:
On the stovetop or grill, the Lodge Cast Iron Grill Press keeps bacon from curling and presses out unwanted grease from burgers. When preheated, the press also significantly speeds up cooking time. The heavy-duty cast iron base with a rustic hammered finish provides excellent heat retention for consistent, even cooking, and the spiral handle allows for a safe, comfortable grip. This grill press is safe to use in the oven, on the stove or grill, and over a campfire. The Lodge Cast Iron Grill Press is made for decades of cooking and comes pre-seasoned for an easy-release finish that improves with use. Assembly requires a flathead screwdriver and an adjustable wrench or pliers. Includes one Lodge Cast Iron Grill Press, 6.75 Inch x 4.5 Inch. Made in America. Care instructions for cast iron: 1. Wash with warm water. Add a mild soap, if desired. 2. Dry thoroughly with a lint-free cloth or paper towel. 3. Oil the surface of the pan with a very light layer of cooking oil while warm. Hang or store the cookware in a dry place.

AMAZON.COM
For the stovetop or the grill, this press pushes out the excess fat in burgers or chicken, eliminates the curl in bacon or ham, and retains the heat in grilled sandwiches. Made of heavy cast iron and weighing about 3 pounds, the grill press uses its heft to do the work. The press measures 6-3/4 by 4-1/2 inches and has a unique hammered finish. A cool-grip spiral handle keeps hands comfortable when working over a hot grill.--Cristina Vaamonde
